The maximum bank angle can be increased to 30° between 200 ft and 400 ft as part of a special procedure with prior approval from the Authority.

variant.question:

 **(Assuming all other factors remain unchanged)**

options.text: Corresponds to a higher cost index.
Leads to a longer flight time for a given distance travelled.
Is more fuel efficient.
Has a higher angle of attack

variant.question: For a jet aeroplane, the maximum climb angle is achieved at a speed corresponding to:

options.text: the maximum CL/CD ratio.
the maximum CL/CD2 ratio.

variant.question: For a jet aeroplane, the maximum climb angle is achieved at a speed corresponding to:

variant.question: For jet aeroplanes which of the following statements is correct?

options.text: When determining the maximum allowable Landing Mass at destination, 60% of the available distance is taken into account, if the runway is expected to be dry.
The required landing field length is the distance from 35 ft to the full stop point.
In any case runway slope is one of the factors taken into account when determining the required landing field length.
An anti-skid system malfunction has no effect on the required landing field length.

options.text: The maximum bank angle can be increased to 20° between 200ft and 400ft as part of a special procedure with prior approval from the Authority.
The maximum bank angle can be increased to 20° above 400ft as part of a special procedure with prior approval from the Authority.
The maximum bank angle can be increased to 35° between 200ft and 400ft as part of a special procedure with prior approval from the Authority.

variant.question: Which of the following statements is correct for a turbojet in the NTOFP?

options.text: The maximum bank angle can be increased to not more than 30° above 400ft as part of a special procedure with prior approval from the Authority.
The maximum bank angle can be increased to not more than 25° above 400ft as part of a special procedure with prior approval from the Authority.
The maximum bank angle can be increased to not more than 20° above 400ft as part of a special procedure with prior approval from the Authority.
